H0.text: Jonas Salk is the scientist credited with developing the polio vaccine.

H1.text: Neil Armstrong is credited for the development of the polio vaccine.

H2.text: Albert Einstein is credited for the development of the polio vaccine.

H3.text: Jacques Cousteau is credited for the development of the polio vaccine.

A4.text: The first effective polio vaccine was developed in 1952 by Jonas Salk and a team at the University of Pittsburgh

A5.text: The first successful demonstration of a polio vaccine was by Hilary Koprowski in 1950, with a live attenuated virus that people drank

A6.text: The Salk vaccine is based on poliovirus grown in a type of monkey kidney tissue culture (vero cell line), which is chemically inactivated with formalin.

A7.text: Albert Sabin developed a polio vaccine that can be administered orally (oral polio vaccine - OPV).
